title: Battlestar Galactica star Richard Hatch dies aged 71 after pancreatic cancer battle
text:
SCI FI STAR DIES Battlestar Galactica star Richard Hatch dies aged 71 after pancreatic cancer battle 
The actor, who was best known for playing Captain Apollo on the TV series passed away after a battle with pancreatic cancer By ELLIE FLYNN Comments BATTLESTAR Galactica star Richard Hatch has died aged 71. 
The actor, who was best known for playing Captain Apollo on the TV series passed away after a battle with pancreatic cancer. Rex Features Battlestar Galactica hero Richard Hatch has died aged 71 Getty Images Hatch passed away in a hospice after a battle with pancreatic cancer, his family said Rex Features The star was nominated for a Best Actor Golden Globe for his role in the hit sci-fi show 
Richard died in hospice care on Tuesday, his family told TMZ . 
He was best known for his role in the sci-fi classic, but began working in television in 1970 when he joined the cast of “All My Children.” 
The star was nominated for a Golden Globe for Best Actor in a TV series in 1979 for his role in Battlestar Galactica. Richard went on to write and produce, as well as starring in The Love Boat, Baywatch, Dynasty and Santa Barbara. 
He also made several appearances in ’80s shows, such as “Murder, She Wrote” and “Fantasy Island”. 
He worked right up until his final illness and appeared in Stlanta at Dragon Con last September. 
The star spoke about his new sci-fi film Diminuendo at the convention. Getty Images The star died in hospice care after a battle with pancreatic cancer Getty Images Richard’s family broke the news of his tragic death 
Tributes have been pouring in for the much-loved actor online. 
Star Trek actor George Takei wrote on Twitter: “Rest with the galactic stars, Richard Hatch.” 
Nerdist added: “We are so sad to hear about the passing of # BattlestarGalactica’s original Captain Apollo, Richard Hatch. RIP, so say we all.”
